Posts.Content: Sashie wrote: Hi, I just had a stereotactic biopsy and they found a which turned out to be a high risk benign calcification, focal atypial lobular hyperplasia. I am thrilled it was benign but the more I read about this condition the more I get scared. Now they want to do an excisional biopsy to make sure they is nothing else there. I have read different things on the internet some saying excisional is standard of care some saying not necessary. The procedure means more mammos and more radiation. I already had had quite a bit of radiation in the last 2 months with the regular mammo, then magnified views, mammo stereotactic and now they want to do wire localiztion excisional biopsy. I keep going back and forth between should I have the procedure or just wait and see. Very scared, Sashie Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stereotactic biopsy now excisional! ALH Very scared Sashie clueless1
